description:
Pseudocercospora fijiensis CIRAD86 is a species of fungus that belongs to the genus Pseudocercospora. It is a plant pathogen that causes a disease known as black Sigatoka or black leaf streak in banana plants (Musa spp.).

The fungus is characterized by its dark-colored septate hyphae and conidiophores that arise from the stomata on the lower surface of banana leaves. The conidia (spores) produced by the fungus are long, slender, and hyaline (transparent) with multiple septa (cross-walls).

Pseudocercospora fijiensis CIRAD86 is a significant threat to banana production worldwide, as it can cause significant yield losses and reduce the quality of the fruit if left uncontrolled. The disease is typically managed through a combination of cultural practices, resistant cultivars, and the application of fungicides.
